page.title: 03THE BLUEBELL STEAM-RAILWAY 1
page.content: The Bluebell Railway runs from Sheffield Park to Horstead-Keynes.It is five miles long.The only station,in our block is Freshfield Halt. It attracts most of its customers at weekends.In a season it carries 250, 000 to 300,000 people.Most of the people come from an area of 50 to 60 miles around Sheffield Park.The railway has 32 engines but only 12 are working.The others are being restored. The railway appeared in many films eg 'Bullshot'and the sequel to the'Dirty Dozen'.It is mostly used for television and radio.Many famous people have been to the railway apart from filmstars like Lord Montagu,Lord Stockton,Rev.W.Audrey,(author of children's books) and the President Johnny Morris.The railway has an excellent safety record.
